cyclone.name: ETA
cyclone.current_location: about 65 miles WSW of St. Petersburg, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: moving north then turning north-northeast and northeast, crossing the northern Florida peninsula and then moving into the western Atlantic
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: northern Florida peninsula (near the Big Bend / Cedar Key area)

weather_observation.watch_coast: North of the Suwannee River to Aucilla River, FL
weather_observation.warning_coast: Bonita Beach to Suwannee River, FL (Tropical Storm Warning) and Bonita Beach to Suwannee River including Tampa Bay & Charlotte Harbor (Storm-Surge Warning)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: West-central and northern Gulf coast of Florida, then southeast U.S. Atlantic coast
weather_observation.wind: Occasional tropical-storm-force gusts possible (20–35 mph sustained winds most likely)
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor coastal inundation of 1–2 ft possible along Atlantic beaches due to onshore swell
weather_observation.rainfall: Additional 1–2 inches common with isolated higher totals; flash-flood risk on already saturated ground
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous surf and rip currents along southeast Florida beaches
